inscription: Recto, u.r. in gold pastel:  PIERRE.
signed: Recto, l.l.: À MATHILDE / -ALEXIS VOLLON / 15 Juillet 1896
text: Alexis Vollon was a versatile and respected painter and printmaker working in Paris. His prolific output of landscapes, still-lifes, portraits, and scenes of actors and everyday life clearly catered to public demand. But this exceptionally sensitive image is different. It is a portrait of his son Pierre and is dedicated to his wife, Mathilde. Pierre seems to have disappeared from the documentary record at a young age. His strict profile and solemn demeanor, plus the dedication to Mathilde, lead one to think that this could well be a memorial portrait of a recently deceased child given to a grieving mother.
title: Portrait of the Artist's Son Pierre
